reviews.sentence: Girls Week In Vegas. We planned a trip to Vegas to celebrate our 50th birthdays. We chose the Flamingo for the location and the fact it said the rooms had been renovated. If the renovation took place it was a while ago and the furniture and bathrooms were not done on the 8th floor. Check in took 2 hours. ridiculous. I have stayed at other hotels in Vegas arriving at the same time 20 pm with no line ups or minimal line ups. The wifi at the hotel was very unreliable and I was unable to receive any emails while I was there which was very inconvenient I am on call 247 for work. I had to go to the Linq or Harahs to retrieve my emails. These were the negatives. positives were the location beds were very comfortable pool was great and afternoon drink specials were awesome 2 for one margaritas at Carlos Charlies from 2 to 4. I recommend the hotel if you check in after 60 less line up. and if you do not require wifi.

Birthday Wekrf. It was my 65th birthday weekend with my husband. We had tickets for Dony and Marie well worth the money. Truly everything was great but not our bathroom. The tub was in dire need of repair or better yet replacement.

Perfect if you have the extra money to throw around. My hubby and I came up for just 1 Saturday night and booked one of the new King GO. rooms. It was sufficient for what we needed it for somewhere to get a few hours to rest before driving back to SoCal clean the self checkin is super fast and easy and of course Margaritavile was right downstairsThe rooms were clean had plenty of towels and the beds were redic comfy but though they claim to be newly renovated there was quite a bit of wear on the dresser and the wood covering was peeling off. The location is convenient to just about every big hotel we walked to BLT Steak in Balys in less than 10 min in heels lol and the casino area was not terrible in the Flamingo but it smelled old. WAY too expensive even for VegasThere are nicer more modern hotels for half the price. I would stay again if they were running a good sale but I am almost embarrassed by how much we spent for 1 night in a bare bones room.

Best time ever. Although pretty basic in the standard room it was pret big. especially compared to when we stayed previously at the link. Could do with abit of updating and new hairdryers but on the hole it was perfect for what we needed as when in vegas you tend to only be in the room to slepPols were amazing go pool you had2 be there early though to getba sunbedwe tended to use the other pool which was alot easier to get a bed at. Casino was fab and food court pretty good. We went to the little bar at the front of the hotel next to thr cromwell n the drinks were pretty reasonable and the bar staff were lovelyWe also had a couple of nights inside the mexican restaurant which turns into a pretty cool bar on the evening with a fab dj and an open bar for 25 or 30 for branded drinkscanot think of the name off the top of my head but u ca nt miss it just down the few steps from the check in desk. will update when i remember the namefab atmosphere in there if not looking for a heavy night of clubingWe got charged 2x extra for connecting phones to the wifi which we did nt do but tbh the que for check out was huge that it would have held us up when trying to get to the airportUber picks you up just by the main taxi rank at the back of check in. Another handy tip is that we found the address for a dollar tree store and the uber worked out about £ 6 each way n wa definitely worth it to stock up on soda and chips etc and their was also a target on the same retail parkwe got stuff litrualy at a fraction of the price from off the strip 2ltr bottle of sprite cost 7 off the strip. And there is a small liquor shop past the car garage that s crazy cheap by the hotel10 for litre of Smirnof. All in all we had a fab time. amazing views and great location with ceasers been litrualy acros the strip and next to the linq promenade. Will definitely be returning.

Terrible first impression. Upgrade helped but this place needs work. Let me start this review by providing a disclaimer I rate properties on value. It not fair to compare lower grade hotels and resorts to higher as it is just not apples to apples. But an experience can be rated by whether is meets or exceeds expectations. We are not above staying anywhere or too good to stay in some places but we believe it is fair to expect to at least get what you pay for. Realizing we were late to get into a hotel on the strip during CES we knew availability would be limited and prices would be inflated but never did we expect to land in a basically condemned room for 450night. Again we would have been happy to stay in a room this bad had we paid 80 night and we are not even sure it was worth that. We got in late so after dinner and some meetings we did not have a chance to really see the hotel room we were assigned at the Flamingo until it was too late and we were too exhausted to be able to do anything about it on the first night. Kudos to the auto check in kiosks though which helped circumvent a long check in line. It was apparent that the room and wing of the Flamingo we were staying in was an older more dilapidated part of the property. This is fine though and almost adds to that classic and vintage Vegas strip ambiance really part of the Flamingos appeal. The room was lack luster at it was best not to imagine what a black light might reveal. But again we were okay with what seemed like a decent room for the 450night rate paid. But then the next morning we wake up and start getting ready for some more meetings and click the lights on in the bathroom. The completely unacceptable condition of the bathroom can not be adequately described. You will have to refer to our photos to see the absolutely appalling and disgusting neglect of cleaning and maintenance. It is not as if the room had not been cleaned since the last guest it is more so the room had not been visited in years. The worst part was the significant amount of rust and paint peeling off the shower ceiling and a shower air duct vent so neglected it must have had years of dust and mold built up on its slats. You will have to see the photo to believe it. Maybe the hotel decided to open up some rooms that were slated for renovation or maybe they thought they could see who could be taken advantage of given the high room demand during CES. Either way it was bad enough for us to take our grievances to hotel management. We showed these very same photos to a receptionist who had an immediate visceral reaction. She quickly called a manager over who reviewed the photos and decided on the spot to upgrade us to a suite. This was a very nice and appreciated gesture and the only reason this rating is not 15. The new room was fantastic and definitely improved the rest of our stay but we could not shake the disgust of the original experience paired with the fact that the hotel may have fully known the conditions of this room and decided to book it anyway. If there can be anything positive to say it was that the new room was nice definitely clean and did not look like there was mold blowing out of the vents onto you while you shower. Also the receptionist and the manager were very sympathetic and quick to remedy the situation. Still a guest paying 450night or event over 100 night should never be put into that situation in the first place. We did have the opportunity to check out some great restaurants and bars while in Vegas which will warrant their own reviews as to not lump them into the experience at the Flamingo. Our advice inspect your room fully upon checking in and before hopping into the showerChers.

Fabulous Flamingo Upgrades. We arrived on a Sunday night and were checked in quickly. The front desk clerk advised that the room we originally booked was not available. We wanted a room with a view. For only 200 more a night we were upgraded to a newly renovated 4 months ago Go Room. It was well worth the money. Lovely large room new furnishings large flat screen TV fridge and large bathroom with a walk in shower. We had a great view of the gardens and High Roller Wheel. Enjoyed time sitting in the garden with our morning coffee and breakfast from the conveniently located snack bar just off the Habitat Tower. Nice selection of slots and good cocktail service. Looking forward to returning soon. Highly recommend this hotel.

Wish that returning guests who keep coming back to the same property over and over again could get special perks when requesting things especially for special occasions. Asked for a free upgrade on my room because it was my husbands birthday but did not get it. Was hoping for either a newly renovated room or a go room which I have been upgraded to before for free. We have been to the Flamingo over and over again many times. it is our home away from home. We were given a room on the top floor with an amazing strip view that was the good part. Bad part was that the room was very outdated especially the bathroom and we heard the music from the Drais club until three in the morning. We love the Flamingo but just hoping that maybe when you see customers returning time after time you can give them at least a half decent room. I hate to complain but it is just how I felt this time especially when it was day after hubbys birthday. Thanks.

Okay. The bed were comfortable and very central. The fact renovations were going on and was told nothing about it until I figured it out for myself as we entered the room. Then the best they could do was ear plugs that never got delivered to our room.
Great location and room but overpriced. Renovated rooms are nice. Location is great. Wi Fi connection is a joke. The smoking floors are poorly ventilated. Noisy because the undergoing renovation.
Nicely renovated rooms. They did a good job with the renovation of our room. I had family stay in the older rooms and there was no comparison to ours. Very clean and comfortable.

All in all an excellent stay and we would most certainly recommend it. I was certainly concerned after reading some negative reviews. I think the key is that you get a renovated room. We did as we paid extra for that and it was just like the pictures. The beds were very comfortable our view was wonderful. Super strange but there were handprints on the outside of the window and we were on the 25th floor. The shower and bathroom were nice the carpets were not filthy as many reviews had mentioned and housekeeping did a beautiful job of our room daily. Perhaps a few dollars each day helps but I feel like that should be given if your room is up to your expectations anyways. The buffet was excellent. The staff were helpful check in was not time consuming at all and although our room was not ready for an early check in as we had requested they took our bags and stored them and reserved a room with a view for us for peace of mind at regular check in time. All in all although I was definitely anxious given some reviews I have absolutely wonderful things to say and I would most definitely returnThe only thing I would change is the goddamn timeshare people. They hassle you we got suckered in of course we said no to purchasing a timeshare because it ’s ridiculous but they should not be allowed to freely harass paying customers of your hotel. That was extremely extremely frustrating for both my husband and I.

Love the renovation. The renovated rooms are 10x nicer and cleaner than the old rooms. We were hesitant on putting our wedding room block here but loved it so much we did. The rooms were attractive and the location is perfect on the strip.

Getting tired. It ’s been quite awhile since we ’ve stayed here and the changes are very apparent to us. We came to Vegas to see Celine Dions final concerts and because of proximity to Caesars and past experience we chose Flamingo. Check in what a mess. We waited 15 hours in line to check in. They have 16 18 stations and only 3 people working and we were 11th in line. The clerk said that they ’re hoping people will utilize the kiosk check in instead. I had reserved a king bed but surprise. it was n’t available. they were sold out. but they ’d be happy to upgrade me for only 15 a night. No I did n’t want to pay more so they gave us a room with 2 queen overlooking the Habitat. The room. well it like other areas has n’t been updated in some time. The furnishings are dated showing their age and it ’s obvious that they have n’t painted or cleaned the carpets in some time. The main floor of the hotel plus the outdoor areas are not being maintained. Honestly we would n’t be surprised if they were n’t ramping down service to close the place. Because they used quality materials years ago much still looks ok but the soft furnishings are wearing and the hardscapes in the habitat are in rough shape in areas. The days of inexpensive meals is long gone in Vegas they have a food court Johnny Rocket. 80 for so so chocolate shake a pizza place chinese and a sandwich shop. Their buffet is 22 a person for breakfast but they ’re closed after 2The saving grace was the newer property adjacent to Flaming called Linq. There ’s an outdoor area with shops and a multitude of restaurants there. most things do n’t open until after 10 or 2 but there ’s quite a variety. Smoke is heavy everywhere in Vegas Flamingo is no exception and someone somewhere determined that cranking up the volume on the music was a good idea because it ’s loud and overwhelming. A walk over to the Mirage is good to get away from it.

Old tired room. Had a 28th floor room that was not updated. Dresser drawers opened with difficulty dresser chipped. Bathroom tile chipped. Old couch — looked like it was covered in plastic. Noisy at night. Windows dirty. Lukewarm water for shower — maintenance said boiler could not keep up. After I complained to front desk 15 nights of resort charge was taken off. Wi fi only allowed 2 devices to be on it without charge. So resort fee is 40 night and you can only have 2 devices. Pool not open yet for season — what does resort fee cover then. You get 10 credit at certain coffee bars in resort if you do n’t take housekeeping — confusing how to use this credit. Great location on north end of Strip. Use of kiosks to check in were nice. Friends had a nice updated room on 10th floor but still no hot water they said.
My room seemed newly renovated and clean. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The room was spacious.

1st but not last visit. We stayed at the Flamingo for 5 days. This was our first time to Las Vegas and I would absolutely recomend this hotel. The check in was fast the room was clean and beautiful. We went to the buffet once and really enjoyed it. The best part of this hotel is the location. It is right in the heart of the strip. We hope to be back in the next few months. Our room was a newly renovated room on the 18th floor.

Older rooms are dirty one star hotel quality. Stayed one night in one of the older un renovated rooms because it was all they had. 186 night. Room was musty peeling paint and rusty metal everywhere. Exposed light bulbs for lights. No USB plugs for your phone glasses had not been washed from previous guest and still had lip stick on them. Bathroom smelled like cigarette smoke. Loud dance music until 4 am. Spend your hard earned money else where.

Not family friendly. They closed 34 of the pool to families to make a 21 club. We stayed here because we have loved the pool in the past. The kids were super disappointed. The now tiny family pool is so packed you can never get a seat let alone as a group unles you get in line 30 minutes before it opens. Only half the pool opens at 9 am the other half at 11 am. you are not allowed to take drinks to the pool that you bought elsewhere on the property only dump what you just bought and buy their 23 ones. We got yelled at for trying to move two pool chairs next to each other apparently not allowed. They make doing everything extremely difficult and unenjoyable. The remodeled rooms look nice but the bathroom smelled a little moldy. The location is great but the building excpet the rooms is pretty dated and a bit grungy. The flamingo habitat is a joke. This hotel used to be great not anymore.

Flamingo renovation flop. Booked the newly renovated rooms with a view of the highroler observation wheel. Room lacked character. I booked a non smoking room only to find room reeked of cigarettes smoke but according to the front desk the hotel was booked so they could not re room me. I will probably not stay here again. Sticking with Harahs or Paris one of the higher end resorts within caesars.

Stayed here for night in the newly renovated rooms. For location and price this is probably th best place you can stay in Vegas. The new rooms and clean compared to what it was years ago you would not be able to tell it is still the Flamingo. Next time I go to Vegas I will be booking this hotel for their pool parties.

Stayed at The Flamingo hotel for 5 days at the flamingo room 22nd floor it was fully renovated so everything looked new the beds were so comfortable and was very clean the only con is that they allow smoking throughout pretty much all around the lobby and most of the hotel areas and also the elevators and it ’s hard to get away from the smoke But other than that the service is great and the non smoking room was perfect.

Pre Halloween at Flamingo. Flamingo was great. We stayed in a mini suite in the newly remodeled Flamingo rooms. The room was nicely appointed with a beautiful bathroom lots of storage area safe and refrigerator. The staff here are always welcoming and helpful. The location can not be beat. The Wyndam staff trying to sell you time shares are a little annoying but make it a game and if you are a couple walk separately to and from the elevators and they will not bother you.
Overall an okay stay. The rooms have been renovated and are nice. The main lobby casino is still super smoky. Do not recommend for anyone with allergies or sensitivities.

On check in we were told that our Flamingo Executive room was not available but a Go Executive room was and it was just as nice with a view of the strip. We wanted a recently remodeled room which we knew the Flamingo Exec was. Wiliam told us the Go Executive room also was recently remodeled. We found out the next day that the Go Exec room was remodeled 10 years ago and our room certainly was showing it is age with missing shower handle parts dirty carpeting and peeling wall paper. We switched rooms an inconvenience to be sure after one night and got we paid for. Next time just tell us the truth please at check in and upgrade us for a night instead of down grading us. Thank you.
Loved the newly renovated room. Thanks to security and maintenance for quick response to our dead battery in or room door.
A big and beautiful hotel but I think the restrooms should be renovated.

The Flamingo is one of my favorite hotels. I love the overall theme of the hotel and the fact that they have real flamingos. The rooms are nice but they need to be repaired. Both of the tv ’s in my bathroom and the other bathroom of a room I booked did not work. The shower door in one of my rooms did not close.
Amazing hotel. Love the remodel very great atmosphere and service.
The Flamingo is a great location on the Strip. The rooms could be updated but the staff and housekeeping were friendly and prompt with solving any issues we had.
